result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Dickelman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs to avoid serving jail time.

Stayed. If defendant pays fine and costs in full on or before 7/25/16, stay will be permanent. If defendant fails to pay fine and costs in full on or before 7/25/16, stay will be lifted and defendant will need to report to jail. Good time and huber privileges granted. 60 days from sentencing date to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Dickelman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew J Dickelman in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises of extensive discussions with Defendant, is comfortable having Defendant enter plea so quickly. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Andrew J Dickelman in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates PD office will be appointing counsel as he has a conflict. Court reschedules matter. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. To be fingerprinted and photographed within 10 days.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew J Dickelman
Current: 620 Shorecrest Road, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235 United States  (Effective: 04-12-2016)
Prior: 7697 Chapel Ln, Baileys Harbor, WI 54202
Defendant appears on his own at 1:00 pm.

Defendant Andrew J Dickelman in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant would like time to contact PD office to see if he qualifies or contact own atty. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
